intro: Arthromeris elegans, commonly known as the elegant arthromeris, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are often broad and can store water, adapting it to its natural habitat. Arthromeris elegans is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and unique growth habits.
